intro: Monanthotaxis bidaultii, commonly known as the Bidault's monanthotaxis, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and poison ivy. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and produces small, clustered flowers. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to the arid conditions of its native environment. Due to its unique morphology and restricted distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
